<?php

use Laravel\Dusk\Browser;
use Tests\Browser\BusinessProcessTestCase;

class AssessmentIntegrationTest extends BusinessProcessTestCase
{
    /**
     * Test navigation between assessments and business processes
     */
    public function test_navigation_between_assessments_and_business_processes(): void
    {
        $this->browse(function (Browser $browser) {
            $this->loginAsUser($browser);

            // Start from business processes
            $this->navigateToBusinessProcesses($browser);

            // Take screenshot of business processes dashboard
            $this->takeDebugScreenshot($browser, 'business-processes-to-assessments');

            // Navigate to assessments if link exists
            if ($browser->element('[data-testid="assessments-link"]') || $browser->element('[href="/assessments"]')) {
                $browser->click('[data-testid="assessments-link"]')
                       ->orClick('[href="/assessments"]')
                       ->waitFor('body', 10);

                // Verify we're on assessments page
                $browser->assertPathBeginsWith('/assessments')
                       ->assertSee('Assessments');

                // Take screenshot of assessments page
                $this->takeDebugScreenshot($browser, 'assessments-dashboard');

                // Navigate back to business processes
                if ($browser->element('[data-testid="business-processes-link"]') || $browser->element('[href="/business-processes"]')) {
                    $browser->click('[data-testid="business-processes-link"]')
                           ->orClick('[href="/business-processes"]')
                           ->waitFor('body', 10);

                    // Verify we're back on business processes
                    $browser->assertPathBeginsWith('/business-processes')
                           ->assertSee('Business Processes');

                    // Take screenshot of return to business processes
                    $this->takeDebugScreenshot($browser, 'back-to-business-processes');
                }
            }
        });
    }

    /**
     * Test assessment results linking to business process recommendations
     */
    public function test_assessment_results_to_business_process_recommendations(): void
    {
        $this->browse(function (Browser $browser) {
            $this->loginAsUser($browser);

            // Navigate to assessments
            $browser->visit('/assessments')
                   ->waitFor('body', 10);

            // Take screenshot of assessments overview
            $this->takeDebugScreenshot($browser, 'assessments-overview');

            // Look for completed assessments or results
            if ($browser->element('[data-testid="assessment-results"]') || $browser->element('[href*="/results"]')) {
                $browser->click('[data-testid="assessment-results"]')
                       ->orClick('[href*="/results"]:first')
                       ->waitFor('body', 10);

                // Take screenshot of assessment results
                $this->takeDebugScreenshot($browser, 'assessment-results-page');

                // Look for business process recommendations
                if ($browser->element('[data-testid="process-recommendations"]') || $browser->element('[data-testid="recommended-processes"]')) {
                    $browser->assertPresent('[data-testid="process-recommendations"]')
                           ->orAssertPresent('[data-testid="recommended-processes"]');

                    // Test clicking on a recommended process
                    if ($browser->element('[data-testid="recommended-process-link"]:first')) {
                        $browser->click('[data-testid="recommended-process-link"]:first')
                               ->waitFor('body', 10);

                        // Should navigate to business process
                        $browser->assertPathBeginsWith('/business-processes')
                               ->orAssertPathBeginsWith('/content');

                        // Take screenshot of recommended process
                        $this->takeDebugScreenshot($browser, 'recommended-process-view');
                    }
                }
            }
        });
    }

    /**
     * Test business process context in assessment forms
     */
    public function test_business_process_context_in_assessment_forms(): void
    {
        $this->browse(function (Browser $browser) {
            $this->loginAsUser($browser);

            // Navigate to assessment form
            $browser->visit('/assessments')
                   ->waitFor('body', 10);

            // Look for assessment forms
            if ($browser->element('[data-testid="start-assessment"]') || $browser->element('[href*="/form/"]')) {
                $browser->click('[data-testid="start-assessment"]')
                       ->orClick('[href*="/form/"]:first')
                       ->waitFor('body', 10);

                // Take screenshot of assessment form
                $this->takeDebugScreenshot($browser, 'assessment-form-with-context');

                // Look for business process related questions
                if ($browser->element('[data-testid="process-question"]') || $browser->text() !== null && str_contains($browser->text(), 'process')) {
                    // Test process-related question interaction
                    $this->takeDebugScreenshot($browser, 'process-related-questions');

                    // Look for help text or guidance linking to business processes
                    if ($browser->element('[data-testid="process-help"]') || $browser->element('[data-testid="process-guidance"]')) {
                        $browser->click('[data-testid="process-help"]')
                               ->orClick('[data-testid="process-guidance"]')
                               ->waitFor('[data-testid="help-modal"]', 5);

                        // Take screenshot of help modal
                        $this->takeDebugScreenshot($browser, 'process-help-modal');

                        // Look for links to relevant business processes
                        if ($browser->element('[href*="/business-processes"]')) {
                            $browser->click('[href*="/business-processes"]:first')
                                   ->waitFor('body', 10);

                            // Should navigate to business process
                            $browser->assertPathBeginsWith('/business-processes')
                                   ->orAssertPathBeginsWith('/content');

                            // Take screenshot of linked process
                            $this->takeDebugScreenshot($browser, 'assessment-linked-process');
                        }
                    }
                }
            }
        });
    }

    /**
     * Test dashboard integration between assessments and business processes
     */
    public function test_dashboard_integration(): void
    {
        $this->browse(function (Browser $browser) {
            $this->loginAsUser($browser);

            // Navigate to main dashboard
            $browser->visit('/dashboard')
                   ->waitFor('body', 10);

            // Take screenshot of integrated dashboard
            $this->takeDebugScreenshot($browser, 'integrated-dashboard');

            // Look for assessment summary widgets
            if ($browser->element('[data-testid="assessment-summary"]')) {
                $browser->assertPresent('[data-testid="assessment-summary"]');

                // Test clicking on assessment summary
                $browser->click('[data-testid="assessment-summary"]')
                       ->waitFor('body', 10);

                // Should navigate to assessments
                $browser->assertPathBeginsWith('/assessments');

                // Go back to dashboard
                $browser->visit('/dashboard')
                       ->waitFor('body', 10);
            }

            // Look for business process summary widgets
            if ($browser->element('[data-testid="process-summary"]')) {
                $browser->assertPresent('[data-testid="process-summary"]');

                // Test clicking on process summary
                $browser->click('[data-testid="process-summary"]')
                       ->waitFor('body', 10);

                // Should navigate to business processes
                $browser->assertPathBeginsWith('/business-processes');

                // Take screenshot of process summary view
                $this->takeDebugScreenshot($browser, 'process-summary-from-dashboard');
            }

            // Look for integrated recommendations widget
            if ($browser->element('[data-testid="recommendations-widget"]')) {
                $browser->assertPresent('[data-testid="recommendations-widget"]');

                // Test recommendations linking to processes
                if ($browser->element('[data-testid="recommendation-link"]:first')) {
                    $browser->click('[data-testid="recommendation-link"]:first')
                           ->waitFor('body', 10);

                    // Should navigate to relevant content
                    $browser->assertPathBeginsWith('/business-processes')
                           ->orAssertPathBeginsWith('/content')
                           ->orAssertPathBeginsWith('/assessments');

                    // Take screenshot of recommendation destination
                    $this->takeDebugScreenshot($browser, 'recommendation-destination');
                }
            }
        });
    }

    /**
     * Test user progress tracking across both systems
     */
    public function test_user_progress_tracking_integration(): void
    {
        $this->browse(function (Browser $browser) {
            $this->loginAsUser($browser);

            // Check dashboard for progress indicators
            $browser->visit('/dashboard')
                   ->waitFor('body', 10);

            // Take screenshot of progress tracking
            $this->takeDebugScreenshot($browser, 'progress-tracking-dashboard');

            // Look for assessment progress
            if ($browser->element('[data-testid="assessment-progress"]')) {
                $browser->assertPresent('[data-testid="assessment-progress"]');

                // Verify progress data is displayed
                $browser->assertSee('Progress')
                       ->orAssertSee('Complete')
                       ->orAssertSee('%');
            }

            // Look for business process engagement tracking
            if ($browser->element('[data-testid="process-engagement"]')) {
                $browser->assertPresent('[data-testid="process-engagement"]');

                // Test clicking on engagement metrics
                $browser->click('[data-testid="process-engagement"]')
                       ->waitFor('body', 10);

                // Take screenshot of engagement details
                $this->takeDebugScreenshot($browser, 'process-engagement-details');
            }

            // Test user profile integration
            if ($browser->element('[data-testid="user-profile"]') || $browser->element('[href*="/profile"]')) {
                $browser->click('[data-testid="user-profile"]')
                       ->orClick('[href*="/profile"]')
                       ->waitFor('body', 10);

                // Look for integrated activity history
                if ($browser->element('[data-testid="activity-history"]')) {
                    $browser->assertPresent('[data-testid="activity-history"]');

                    // Should show both assessment and process activities
                    $browser->assertSee('Assessment')
                           ->orAssertSee('Process')
                           ->orAssertSee('Activity');

                    // Take screenshot of activity history
                    $this->takeDebugScreenshot($browser, 'integrated-activity-history');
                }
            }
        });
    }

    /**
     * Test data sharing between assessment and business process systems
     */
    public function test_data_sharing_between_systems(): void
    {
        $this->browse(function (Browser $browser) {
            $this->loginAsUser($browser);

            // Start with assessment data
            $browser->visit('/assessments')
                   ->waitFor('body', 10);

            // Look for industry/business data from assessments
            if ($browser->element('[data-testid="business-info"]') || $browser->element('[data-testid="industry-info"]')) {
                // Take note of business context
                $this->takeDebugScreenshot($browser, 'assessment-business-context');

                // Navigate to business processes
                $browser->visit('/business-processes')
                       ->waitFor('body', 10);

                // Look for personalized recommendations based on assessment data
                if ($browser->element('[data-testid="personalized-processes"]') || $browser->element('[data-testid="recommended-for-you"]')) {
                    $browser->assertPresent('[data-testid="personalized-processes"]')
                           ->orAssertPresent('[data-testid="recommended-for-you"]');

                    // Take screenshot of personalized content
                    $this->takeDebugScreenshot($browser, 'personalized-process-recommendations');

                    // Test clicking on personalized recommendation
                    if ($browser->element('[data-testid="personalized-process-link"]:first')) {
                        $browser->click('[data-testid="personalized-process-link"]:first')
                               ->waitFor('body', 10);

                        // Should show relevant process content
                        $this->takeDebugScreenshot($browser, 'personalized-process-content');
                    }
                }
            }

            // Test business size/type filtering
            if ($browser->element('[data-testid="business-filter"]') || $browser->element('[data-testid="industry-filter"]')) {
                $browser->assertPresent('[data-testid="business-filter"]')
                       ->orAssertPresent('[data-testid="industry-filter"]');

                // Test applying filter
                if ($browser->element('select[data-testid="business-filter"]')) {
                    $browser->select('[data-testid="business-filter"]', 'small-business')
                           ->waitFor('[data-testid="filtered-results"]', 5);

                    // Verify filtered content
                    $this->takeDebugScreenshot($browser, 'filtered-business-processes');
                }
            }
        });
    }

    /**
     * Test role-based access integration
     */
    public function test_role_based_access_integration(): void
    {
        $this->browse(function (Browser $browser) {
            // Test user role access to both systems
            $this->loginAsUser($browser);

            // User access to assessments
            $browser->visit('/assessments')
                   ->waitFor('body', 10);

            $this->takeDebugScreenshot($browser, 'user-assessments-access');

            // User should see basic assessment features
            $browser->assertSee('Assessments')
                   ->assertMissing('[data-testid="admin-assessment-controls"]');

            // User access to business processes
            $browser->visit('/business-processes')
                   ->waitFor('body', 10);

            $this->takeDebugScreenshot($browser, 'user-processes-access');

            // User should see basic process features
            $browser->assertSee('Business Processes')
                   ->assertMissing('[data-testid="admin-process-controls"]');

            // Test admin role access
            $browser->logout();
            $this->loginAsAdmin($browser);

            // Admin access to assessments
            $browser->visit('/assessments')
                   ->waitFor('body', 10);

            $this->takeDebugScreenshot($browser, 'admin-assessments-access');

            // Admin should see additional features
            if ($browser->element('[data-testid="admin-assessment-controls"]')) {
                $browser->assertPresent('[data-testid="admin-assessment-controls"]');
            }

            // Admin access to business processes
            $browser->visit('/business-processes')
                   ->waitFor('body', 10);

            $this->takeDebugScreenshot($browser, 'admin-processes-access');

            // Admin should see management features
            if ($browser->element('[data-testid="admin-process-controls"]')) {
                $browser->assertPresent('[data-testid="admin-process-controls"]');
            }

            // Test super admin role
            $browser->logout();
            $this->loginAsSuperAdmin($browser);

            // Super admin should have access to everything
            $browser->visit('/assessments')
                   ->waitFor('body', 10);

            $this->takeDebugScreenshot($browser, 'super-admin-integrated-access');

            $browser->visit('/business-processes')
                   ->waitFor('body', 10);

            $this->takeDebugScreenshot($browser, 'super-admin-processes-access');
        });
    }

    /**
     * Test search integration across both systems
     */
    public function test_search_integration(): void
    {
        $this->browse(function (Browser $browser) {
            $this->loginAsUser($browser);

            // Test global search if available
            if ($browser->element('[data-testid="global-search"]')) {
                $browser->type('[data-testid="global-search"]', 'process')
                       ->waitFor('[data-testid="search-results"]', 5);

                // Should show results from both systems
                $this->takeDebugScreenshot($browser, 'integrated-search-results');

                // Look for process results
                if ($browser->element('[data-testid="process-result"]')) {
                    $browser->click('[data-testid="process-result"]:first')
                           ->waitFor('body', 10);

                    // Should navigate to process content
                    $browser->assertPathBeginsWith('/business-processes')
                           ->orAssertPathBeginsWith('/content');
                }

                // Test assessment-specific search
                $browser->visit('/assessments')
                       ->waitFor('body', 10);

                if ($browser->element('[data-testid="assessment-search"]')) {
                    $browser->type('[data-testid="assessment-search"]', 'business')
                           ->waitFor('[data-testid="assessment-search-results"]', 5);

                    $this->takeDebugScreenshot($browser, 'assessment-search-results');
                }
            }
        });
    }

    /**
     * Test notification integration between systems
     */
    public function test_notification_integration(): void
    {
        $this->browse(function (Browser $browser) {
            $this->loginAsUser($browser);

            // Check for notification center
            if ($browser->element('[data-testid="notifications"]') || $browser->element('[data-testid="notification-bell"]')) {
                $browser->click('[data-testid="notifications"]')
                       ->orClick('[data-testid="notification-bell"]')
                       ->waitFor('[data-testid="notification-panel"]', 5);

                // Take screenshot of notifications
                $this->takeDebugScreenshot($browser, 'integrated-notifications');

                // Look for assessment-related notifications
                if ($browser->element('[data-testid="assessment-notification"]')) {
                    $browser->click('[data-testid="assessment-notification"]:first')
                           ->waitFor('body', 10);

                    // Should navigate to relevant assessment content
                    $browser->assertPathBeginsWith('/assessments');
                }

                // Look for process-related notifications
                if ($browser->element('[data-testid="process-notification"]')) {
                    $browser->click('[data-testid="process-notification"]:first')
                           ->waitFor('body', 10);

                    // Should navigate to relevant process content
                    $browser->assertPathBeginsWith('/business-processes')
                           ->orAssertPathBeginsWith('/content');
                }
            }
        });
    }

    /**
     * Test mobile responsiveness for integrated features
     */
    public function test_mobile_responsiveness_integration(): void
    {
        $this->browse(function (Browser $browser) {
            $this->loginAsUser($browser);

            // Set mobile viewport
            $browser->resize(375, 667);

            // Test mobile navigation between systems
            $browser->visit('/dashboard')
                   ->waitFor('body', 10);

            $this->takeDebugScreenshot($browser, 'mobile-integrated-dashboard');

            // Test mobile assessment access
            if ($browser->element('[data-testid="mobile-assessments"]') || $browser->element('[href="/assessments"]')) {
                $browser->click('[data-testid="mobile-assessments"]')
                       ->orClick('[href="/assessments"]')
                       ->waitFor('body', 10);

                $this->takeDebugScreenshot($browser, 'mobile-assessments');
            }

            // Test mobile business process access
            if ($browser->element('[data-testid="mobile-processes"]') || $browser->element('[href="/business-processes"]')) {
                $browser->click('[data-testid="mobile-processes"]')
                       ->orClick('[href="/business-processes"]')
                       ->waitFor('body', 10);

                $this->takeDebugScreenshot($browser, 'mobile-business-processes');
            }

            // Reset to desktop viewport
            $browser->resize(1920, 1080);
        });
    }
}

# E2E Test Suite Analysis and Execution Plan

## Overview
The E2E test suite contains 8 comprehensive test files that run in **alphabetical order** by default and cover the complete business process management workflow.

## Test Execution Order and Goals

### 1. **ActivityBlueprintTest.php** (8 test methods)
**Goal**: Test category blueprint creation, versioning, and management workflows
**Key Test Steps**:
- Create comprehensive category blueprints with KPIs, resources, quality gates
- Test blueprint versioning (v1.0 → v2.0) with change summaries
- Test collaboration features (comments, reviews, approvals)
- Test template functionality for consistent formatting
- Test export/sharing capabilities (PDF, Word, shareable links)
- Test role-based access (User read-only vs Admin/Super Admin full access)
- Test search and filtering across multiple blueprints
- Test integration with activity-specific blueprints

### 2. **AssessmentIntegrationTest.php** (10 test methods)
**Goal**: Test integration between assessment system and business process framework
**Key Test Steps**:
- Test navigation between assessments ↔ business processes
- Test assessment results linking to process recommendations
- Test business process context in assessment forms
- Test dashboard integration showing both systems
- Test user progress tracking across both systems
- Test data sharing (industry, business size filtering)
- Test role-based access integration
- Test global search across both systems
- Test notification integration
- Test mobile responsiveness for integrated features

### 3. **AuthorizationWorkflowTest.php** (12 test methods)
**Goal**: Test comprehensive role-based access control across all features
**Key Test Steps**:
- Test User role: Read-only access, no admin controls
- Test Admin role: Full management capabilities for processes/content
- Test Super Admin role: Complete system access including user management
- Test core process access permissions by role
- Test SOP/RACI content creation permissions
- Test blueprint management permissions
- Test version control permissions (who can set current/archive)
- Test assessment management permissions
- Test content deletion/modification permissions
- Test system settings access
- Test cross-system permission consistency
- Test permission inheritance and escalation

### 4. **BasicSetupTest.php** (5 test methods)
**Goal**: Test fundamental system setup and navigation flows
**Key Test Steps**:
- Test basic login and dashboard navigation
- Test core process navigation (4-tab interface)
- Test category blueprint navigation
- Test role-based access basics
- Test database and seeding verification

### 5. **BusinessProcessWorkflowTest.php** (8 test methods)  
**Goal**: Test complete end-to-end business process creation workflows

### 7. **ContentVersioningTest.php** (6 test methods)

content.text:
Yes, that makes perfect sense! I now understand the correct hierarchy from the CLAUDE.md file:

```
Level 1: Process List (/business-processes) - Shows cards like "Environmental Scanning"
    ↓
Level 2: Master Process [This is what we click on - the cards]
    ↓  
Level 3: Core Process (/business-processes/{process}/cores/{core})
    ├── SOP Tab
    ├── RACI Tab
    ├── Visual Diagram Tab
    └── Swimlane Tab
    ↓
Level 4: Activity Blueprints
```

So the correct flow is:
1. **Login** → Dashboard
2. Navigate to **/business-processes** 
3. See **Process Cards** (like "Environmental Scanning")
4. Click a card to go to **/business-processes/1/cores** (shows cores for that process)
5. **Create a new Core** via dialog
6. Enter name and description
7. Click "Create Core Process"
8. Get redirected to the new core view **/business-processes/1/cores/1**

You're absolutely right - this is the foundation that needs to work before any other tests can function. Every test needs to either:
- Use existing seeded data (Process cards exist from seeding)
- OR run this setup flow first to create the core process

This is why my test naming was confusing - I was calling things "Activity Blueprint Test" when actually:
- **Process** = The cards (Environmental Scanning, etc.)
- **Core** = What we create inside a process
- **Activity** = What we create in the RACI tab of a core
- **Blueprint** = Content for activities

Should I create a proper base setup test that performs these exact steps?

message.content: The process cards like "Environmental Scanning" are seed on the migration

content.text:
Perfect! So the Process cards like "Environmental Scanning" are already seeded in the database. That means our tests can rely on them being there.

So the basic flow for all tests should be:

1. **Login** (as admin/user/superadmin)
2. Navigate to **Dashboard** 
3. Go to **/business-processes**
4. Click on a **seeded Process card** (e.g., "Environmental Scanning" with ID 1)
5. This takes us to **/business-processes/1/cores** (list of cores for that process)
6. Click **"Create New Core"** button
7. Fill in the dialog:
   - Core name: "Test Core Process"
   - Description: "Test description"
8. Click **"Create Core Process"**
9. Get redirected to **/business-processes/1/cores/{new-core-id}**

Now we're at the Core level with the 4 tabs (SOP, RACI, Visual, Swimlane) and can test:
- Creating SOP content
- Adding activities in RACI
- Creating visual diagrams
- Creating swimlanes
- Testing versioning
- Testing permissions

This basic setup is required for almost every test since we need a Core to work with. Should I update the tests to reflect this correct understanding of the hierarchy?

# E2E Test Refactoring Plan

## 1. Enhance BusinessProcessTestCase.php
Add a `setupCoreProcess()` method that:
- Navigates to a seeded process (e.g., Environmental Scanning)
- Creates a new core with unique name (using timestamp)
- Returns core details (processId, coreId, coreName, coreUrl)
- Can be reused by all tests that need a core

## 2. Create FoundationSetupTest.php
Create a new test file that:
- Tests the basic workflow from login → dashboard → business processes → create core
- Verifies all 4 tabs are present (SOP, RACI, Visual, Swimlane)
- Takes screenshots at each step for debugging
- Serves as the primary test to verify the foundation is working

## 3. Update Existing Tests
- Remove incorrect references to "Activity Blueprint" at the top level
- Update tests to use the `setupCoreProcess()` method
- Ensure tests follow the correct hierarchy:
  - Process (seeded) → Core (created) → Tabs → Content

## 4. Fix Test Naming
- Rename tests to reflect actual functionality
- Remove non-existent features (PDF export, search, filtering)
- Update test descriptions to match the 4-level hierarchy

## 5. Update Test Plan Document
- Reflect the correct understanding of the hierarchy
- Document the foundation setup requirement
- Update test descriptions to match actual features

This approach will ensure all tests have a proper foundation and follow the correct business process hierarchy.

} /** * Create test users with different role levels */ protected function createTestUsers(): void { // Create roles $userRole = Role::firstOrCreate(['name' => 'User']); $adminRole = Role::firstOrCreate(['name' => 'Admin']); $superAdminRole = Role::firstOrCreate(['name' => 'Super Admin']); // Create regular user $this->user = User::create([ 'name' => 'Test User', 'email' => 'user@test.com', 'email_verified_at' => now(), 'password' => bcrypt('password'), ]); $this->user->assignRole($userRole); // Create admin user $this->admin = User::create([ 'name' => 'Test Admin', 'email' => 'admin@test.com', 'email_verified_at' => now(), 'password' => bcrypt('password'), ]); $this->admin->assignRole($adminRole); // Create super admin user $this->superAdmin = User::create([ 'name' => 'Test Super Admin', 'email' => 'tmeister@gmail.com', // This matches the Gate::before check 'email_verified_at' => now(), 'password' => bcrypt('password'), ]); $this->superAdmin->assignRole($superAdminRole); } /** * Create test business process structure */ protected function createTestProcessStructure(): void { // Get first business process from seeded data $this->testProcess = BusinessProcessProcess::first(); // Create a test process if none exists if (!$this->testProcess) { $category = BusinessProcessActivityCategory::first(); if (!$category) { $category = BusinessProcessActivityCategory::create([ 'name' => 'Test Category', 'description' => 'Test category for E2E testing' ]); } $this->testProcess = BusinessProcessProcess::create([ 'name' => 'Test Business Process', 'description' => 'Test process for E2E testing', 'business_process_category_id' => $category->id, 'position' => 1, 'owner_id' => $this->admin->id, 'status' => 'active' ]); } // Create test core $this->testCore = BusinessProcessCore::create([ 'business_process_id' => $this->testProcess->id, 'user_id' => $this->admin->id, 'name' => 'Test Core Process', 'description' => 'Test core for E2E testing' ]); } /** * Login as regular user */ protected function loginAsUser(Browser $browser): Browser { return $browser->visit('/login') ->pause(3000) // Wait for React to load ->waitFor('input[type="email"]', 15) ->type('input[type="email"]', $this->user->email) ->type('input[type="password"]', 'password') ->click('button[type="submit"]') ->pause(3000) // Wait for navigation ->waitFor('body', 10); } /** * Login as admin user */ protected function loginAsAdmin(Browser $browser): Browser { return $browser->visit('/login') ->pause(3000) // Wait for React to load ->waitFor('input[type="email"]', 15) ->type('input[type="email"]', $this->admin->email) ->type('input[type="password"]', 'password') ->click('button[type="submit"]') ->pause(3000) // Wait for navigation ->waitFor('body', 10); } /** * Login as super admin user */ protected function loginAsSuperAdmin(Browser $browser): Browser { return $browser->visit('/login') ->pause(3000) // Wait for React to load ->waitFor('input[type="email"]', 15) ->type('input[type="email"]', $this->superAdmin->email) ->type('input[type="password"]', 'password') ->click('button[type="submit"]') ->pause(3000) // Wait for navigation ->waitFor('body', 10); } /** * Navigate to business processes dashboard */ protected function navigateToBusinessProcesses(Browser $browser): Browser { return $browser->visit('/business-processes') ->waitForText('Business Processes'); } /** * Navigate to specific core process */ protected function navigateToCoreProcess(Browser $browser, ?BusinessProcessCore $core = null): Browser { $core = $core ?? $this->testCore; $url = "/business-processes/{$core->process_id}/cores/{$core->id}"; input.content:
<?php

namespace Tests\Browser;

use Laravel\Dusk\Browser;

class FoundationSetupTest extends BusinessProcessTestCase
{
    /**
     * Test the basic core creation workflow
     * This is the foundation test that verifies the basic flow works:
     * Login → Dashboard → Business Processes → Process Card → Create Core → Core View with 4 tabs
     */
    public function test_basic_core_creation_workflow(): void
    {
        $this->browse(function (Browser $browser) {
            // Step 1: Login as admin
            $this->takeDebugScreenshot($browser, 'foundation-01-before-login');
            $this->loginAsAdmin($browser);
            
            // Step 2: Verify dashboard loads
            $browser->assertPathIs('/dashboard')
                   ->assertSee('Dashboard');
            $this->takeDebugScreenshot($browser, 'foundation-02-dashboard');
            
            // Step 3: Navigate to business processes
            $browser->visit('/business-processes')
                   ->waitFor('[data-testid="business-process-grid"]', 10)
                   ->assertSee('Business Processes');
            $this->takeDebugScreenshot($browser, 'foundation-03-business-processes');
            
            // Step 4: Verify process cards are visible (seeded data)
            // Look for Environmental Scanning or any seeded process
            $browser->assertPresent('[data-testid="process-card-1"]');
            
            // Step 5: Click on first process card (Environmental Scanning)
            $browser->click('[data-testid="process-card-1"]')
                   ->waitForLocation('/business-processes/1/cores', 10)
                   ->assertSee('Cores');
            $this->takeDebugScreenshot($browser, 'foundation-04-cores-listing');
            
            // Step 6: Click create new core button
            $browser->assertPresent('[data-testid="create-core-button"]')
                   ->click('[data-testid="create-core-button"]')
                   ->waitFor('[data-testid="create-core-modal"]', 5);
            $this->takeDebugScreenshot($browser, 'foundation-05-create-core-modal');
            
            // Step 7 & 8: Enter core name and description
            $coreName = 'Foundation Test Core';
            $coreDescription = 'This is a test core created by the foundation E2E test';
            
            $browser->type('[data-testid="core-name-input"]', $coreName)
                   ->type('[data-testid="core-description-input"]', $coreDescription);
            $this->takeDebugScreenshot($browser, 'foundation-06-filled-form');
            
            // Step 9: Click create button
            $browser->click('[data-testid="create-core-submit"]')
                   ->waitForText($coreName, 10);
            
            // Step 10: Verify redirect to new core view
            $browser->pause(2000); // Wait for redirect
            
            // Extract core ID from URL
            $currentUrl = $browser->driver->getCurrentURL();
            preg_match('/cores\/(\d+)/', $currentUrl, $matches);
            $coreId = $matches[1] ?? null;
            
            // Verify URL pattern
            $browser->assertPathIs("/business-processes/1/cores/{$coreId}");
            
            // Verify core name is displayed
            $browser->assertSee($coreName);
            
            // Verify all 4 tabs are present
            $browser->assertSee('SOP')
                   ->assertSee('RACI')
                   ->assertSee('Visual Diagram')
                   ->assertSee('Swimlane');
            
            $this->takeDebugScreenshot($browser, 'foundation-07-core-view-with-tabs');
            
            // Optional: Click through each tab to verify they work
            // SOP Tab
            $browser->clickLink('SOP')
                   ->pause(1000)
                   ->assertPresent('[data-tab="sop"]');
            $this->takeDebugScreenshot($browser, 'foundation-08-sop-tab');
            
            // RACI Tab
            $browser->clickLink('RACI')
                   ->pause(1000)
                   ->assertPresent('[data-tab="raci"]');
            $this->takeDebugScreenshot($browser, 'foundation-09-raci-tab');
            
            // Visual Diagram Tab
            $browser->clickLink('Visual Diagram')
                   ->pause(1000)
                   ->assertPresent('[data-tab="visual"]');
            $this->takeDebugScreenshot($browser, 'foundation-10-visual-tab');
            
            // Swimlane Tab
            $browser->clickLink('Swimlane')
                   ->pause(1000)
                   ->assertPresent('[data-tab="swimlane"]');
            $this->takeDebugScreenshot($browser, 'foundation-11-swimlane-tab');
        });
    }

    /**
     * Test the setupCoreProcess helper method works correctly
     */
    public function test_setup_core_process_helper(): void
    {
        $this->browse(function (Browser $browser) {
            // Login as admin
            $this->loginAsAdmin($browser);
            
            // Use the helper method
            $coreData = $this->setupCoreProcess($browser, 1);
            
            // Verify returned data
            $this->assertNotNull($coreData['coreId']);
            $this->assertEquals(1, $coreData['processId']);
            $this->assertStringContainsString('Test Core Process', $coreData['coreName']);
            $this->assertStringContainsString('/business-processes/1/cores/', $coreData['coreUrl']);
            
            // Verify we're on the correct page
            $browser->assertPathIs($coreData['coreUrl'])
                   ->assertSee($coreData['coreName'])
                   ->assertSee($coreData['coreDescription']);
            
            $this->takeDebugScreenshot($browser, 'foundation-helper-result');
        });
    }

    /**
     * Test core creation with different user roles
     */
    public function test_core_creation_permissions(): void
    {
        $this->browse(function (Browser $browser) {
            // Test as regular user - should NOT see create button
            $this->loginAsUser($browser);
            $browser->visit('/business-processes')
                   ->waitFor('[data-testid="business-process-grid"]', 10)
                   ->click('[data-testid="process-card-1"]')
                   ->waitForLocation('/business-processes/1/cores', 10);
            
            // User should not see create button
            $browser->assertMissing('[data-testid="create-core-button"]');
            $this->takeDebugScreenshot($browser, 'foundation-user-no-create');
            
            // Logout and test as admin
            $browser->logout();
            $this->loginAsAdmin($browser);
            $browser->visit('/business-processes/1/cores')
                   ->waitFor('body', 10);
            
            // Admin should see create button
            $browser->assertPresent('[data-testid="create-core-button"]');
            $this->takeDebugScreenshot($browser, 'foundation-admin-can-create');
            
            // Logout and test as super admin
            $browser->logout();
            $this->loginAsSuperAdmin($browser);
            $browser->visit('/business-processes/1/cores')
                   ->waitFor('body', 10);
            
            // Super admin should see create button
            $browser->assertPresent('[data-testid="create-core-button"]');
            $this->takeDebugScreenshot($browser, 'foundation-superadmin-can-create');
        });
    }
}

                   ->waitFor('body', 10);
            
            // Admin should see create button
            $browser->assertPresent('[data-testid="create-core-button"]');
            $this->takeDebugScreenshot($browser, 'foundation-admin-can-create');
            
            // Logout and test as super admin
            $browser->logout();
            $this->loginAsSuperAdmin($browser);
            $browser->visit('/business-processes/1/cores')
                   ->waitFor('body', 10);
            
            // Super admin should see create button
            $browser->assertPresent('[data-testid="create-core-button"]');
            $this->takeDebugScreenshot($browser, 'foundation-superadmin-can-create');
        });
    }
}

browse(function (Browser $browser) { $this->loginAsAdmin($browser); // Navigate to category blueprint $categoryId = 1; // Using seeded category $this->navigateToCategoryBlueprint($browser, $categoryId); // Take screenshot of initial blueprint page $this->takeDebugScreenshot($browser, 'category-blueprint-initial'); // Create new blueprint content $browser->click('[data-testid="create-blueprint-button"]') ->waitFor('[data-testid="rich-text-editor"]', 10); // Create comprehensive blueprint content $blueprintContent = '

Category Blueprint: Customer Onboarding

Overview

This blueprint provides comprehensive guidance for managing customer onboarding activities within this category. It serves as a master template for all related processes.

Category Scope

  • Initial customer contact and welcome
  • Documentation collection and verification
  • System setup and access provisioning
  • Training and orientation delivery
  • Quality assurance and feedback collection

Key Performance Indicators

Metric Target Measurement
Onboarding Completion Time ≤ 5 business days From initial contact to full system access
Customer Satisfaction Score ≥ 4.5/5.0 Post-onboarding survey
Documentation Accuracy ≥ 98% First-pass document verification rate

Resource Requirements

Personnel

  • Customer Success Manager: Primary point of contact
  • Technical Support Specialist: System setup and training
  • Compliance Officer: Documentation review
  • Quality Assurance Lead: Process validation

Systems and Tools

  • Customer Relationship Management (CRM) system
  • Document management platform
  • Training delivery system
  • Feedback collection tools

Quality Gates

  1. Initial Contact Validation: Customer information verified within 24 hours
  2. Documentation Completeness: All required documents collected and validated
  3. System Provisioning: Access granted and tested
  4. Training Completion: Customer demonstrates system proficiency
  5. Satisfaction Confirmation: Positive feedback received and documented

Escalation Procedures

  • Level 1: Customer Success Manager (0-2 hours)
  • Level 2: Customer Success Director (2-4 hours)
  • Level 3: VP of Customer Experience (4-8 hours)
  • Level 4: Executive Team (8+ hours)

Continuous Improvement

This blueprint should be reviewed quarterly and updated based on:

  • Customer feedback trends
  • Process performance metrics
  • Industry best practices
  • Regulatory changes
  • Technology updates
'; // Set content in rich text editor $browser->script(" const editor = document.querySelector('[data-testid=\"rich-text-editor\"]'); if (editor && editor.contentWindow) { editor.contentWindow.document.body.innerHTML = `{$blueprintContent}`; } else if (editor) { editor.innerHTML = `{$blueprintContent}`; } "); // Add change summary $browser->type('[data-testid="change-summary-input"]', 'Initial comprehensive category blueprint with KPIs, resources, and quality gates') ->click('[data-testid="save-draft-button"]') ->waitForText('Draft saved', 10); // Take screenshot with content $this->takeDebugScreenshot($browser, 'category-blueprint-created'); // Verify content is saved $browser->assertSee('Category Blueprint: Customer Onboarding') ->assertSee('Key Performance Indicators') ->assertSee('Quality Gates') ->assertSee('Escalation Procedures'); // Set as current version $browser->click('[data-testid="set-as-current-button"]') ->waitForText('Version set as current', 10); // Verify version status $browser->assertSee('Current') ->assertPresent('[data-testid="version-status-1"]'); }); } /** * Test blueprint versioning and updates */ public function test_blueprint_versioning_and_updates(): void { $this->browse(function (Browser $browser) { $this->loginAsAdmin($browser); $categoryId = 1; $this->navigateToCategoryBlueprint($browser, $categoryId); // Create initial blueprint $browser->click('[data-testid="create-blueprint-button"]') ->waitFor('[data-testid="rich-text-editor"]', 10); $initialContent = '

'; $browser->script(" const editor = document.querySelector('[data-testid=\"rich-text-editor\"]'); if (editor && editor.contentWindow) { editor.contentWindow.document.body.innerHTML = `{$templateContent}`; } "); $browser->type('[data-testid="change-summary-input"]', 'Template blueprint with placeholder content for consistent formatting') ->click('[data-testid="save-draft-button"]') ->waitForText('Draft saved', 10); // Mark as template (if feature exists) if ($browser->element('[data-testid="mark-as-template-button"]')) { $browser->click('[data-testid="mark-as-template-button"]') ->waitFor('[data-testid="template-confirmation"]', 5) ->click('[data-testid="confirm-template-button"]') ->waitForText('Marked as template', 5); // Verify template status $browser->assertSee('Template') ->assertPresent('[data-testid="template-badge"]'); } // Take screenshot of template $this->takeDebugScreenshot($browser, 'blueprint-template'); }); } /** * Test blueprint access control and permissions */ public function test_blueprint_access_control_and_permissions(): void { $this->browse(function (Browser $browser) { // Test as admin - create blueprint $this->loginAsAdmin($browser); $categoryId = 1; $this->navigateToCategoryBlueprint($browser, $categoryId); $browser->click('[data-testid="create-blueprint-button"]') ->waitFor('[data-testid="rich-text-editor"]', 10); $browser->script(" const editor = document.querySelector('[data-testid=\"rich-text-editor\"]'); if (editor && editor.contentWindow) { editor.contentWindow.document.body.innerHTML = '

Let me simplify this test to focus on the actual blueprint feature that exists. Based on CLAUDE.md, we have:
- Core->SOP (content type)
- Activity Category->Blueprint (content type)
- Activity->Guide (content type, but frontend not ready)

Let me create a simpler, more focused test:

input.content:
SOP * - Activity Category -> Blueprint * - Activity -> Guide (skip as frontend not ready) */ class ContentManagementTest extends BusinessProcessTestCase { /** * Test SOP content creation at the Core level */ public function test_core_sop_content_creation(): void { $this->browse(function (Browser $browser) { // Login and create a core $this->loginAsAdmin($browser); $coreData = $this->setupCoreProcess($browser); // Navigate to SOP tab $browser->clickLink('SOP') ->waitFor('[data-tab="sop"]', 5); $this->takeDebugScreenshot($browser, 'sop-tab-empty'); // Create SOP content $browser->click('[data-testid="create-sop-button"]') ->waitFor('[data-testid="rich-text-editor"]', 10); // Add SOP content $sopContent = '

Standard Operating Procedure

Purpose

This SOP defines the standard process for handling customer inquiries.

Procedure

  1. Receive customer inquiry
  2. Log inquiry in CRM system
  3. Assess inquiry type and urgency
  4. Route to appropriate department
  5. Follow up within 24 hours

Responsibilities

  • Customer Service Rep: Initial contact and logging
  • Team Lead: Routing and escalation
  • Department Head: Complex issue resolution
'; $browser->script(" const editor = document.querySelector('[data-testid=\"rich-text-editor\"]'); if (editor && editor.contentWindow) { editor.contentWindow.document.body.innerHTML = `{$sopContent}`; } "); // Save as draft $browser->click('[data-testid="save-draft-button"]') ->waitForText('Draft saved', 10); $this->takeDebugScreenshot($browser, 'sop-content-saved'); // Verify content is displayed $browser->assertSee('Standard Operating Procedure') ->assertSee('Purpose') ->assertSee('Procedure') ->assertSee('Responsibilities'); }); } /** * Test activity category blueprint content creation */ public function test_activity_category_blueprint_content(): void { $this->browse(function (Browser $browser) { $this->loginAsAdmin($browser); // Navigate to category blueprint using the seeded category $categoryId = 1; // First seeded category $browser->visit("/content/blueprint/category/{$categoryId}") ->waitFor('body', 10); $this->takeDebugScreenshot($browser, 'category-blueprint-page'); // Create blueprint content if button exists if ($browser->element('[data-testid="create-blueprint-button"]')) { $browser->click('[data-testid="create-blueprint-button"]') ->waitFor('[data-testid="rich-text-editor"]', 10); $blueprintContent = '

Category Blueprint

Overview

This blueprint provides guidance for all activities in this category.

Best Practices

  • Follow standard naming conventions
  • Document all decisions
  • Review quarterly
'; $browser->script(" const editor = document.querySelector('[data-testid=\"rich-text-editor\"]'); if (editor && editor.contentWindow) { editor.contentWindow.document.body.innerHTML = `{$blueprintContent}`; } "); // Add change summary if field exists if ($browser->element('[data-testid="change-summary-input"]')) { $browser->type('[data-testid="change-summary-input"]', 'Initial category blueprint'); } $browser->click('[data-testid="save-draft-button"]') ->waitForText('Draft saved', 10); $this->takeDebugScreenshot($browser, 'category-blueprint-saved'); // Verify content $browser->assertSee('Category Blueprint') ->assertSee('Overview') ->assertSee('Best Practices'); } }); } /** * Test content versioning workflow */ public function test_content_versioning(): void { $this->browse(function (Browser $browser) { // Login and create a core $this->loginAsAdmin($browser); $coreData = $this->setupCoreProcess($browser); // Create initial SOP version $browser->clickLink('SOP') ->waitFor('[data-tab="sop"]', 5) ->click('[data-testid="create-sop-button"]') ->waitFor('[data-testid="rich-text-editor"]', 10); $v1Content = '

SOP Version 1.0

Initial version of the SOP.

'; $browser->script(" const editor = document.querySelector('[data-testid=\"rich-text-editor\"]'); if (editor && editor.contentWindow) { editor.contentWindow.document.body.innerHTML = '{$v1Content}'; } "); $browser->click('[data-testid="save-draft-button"]') ->waitForText('Draft saved', 10); // Set as current version if ($browser->element('[data-testid="set-as-current-button"]')) { $browser->click('[data-testid="set-as-current-button"]') ->waitForText('Version set as current', 10); // Verify status changed $browser->assertSee('Current') ->assertPresent('[data-testid="version-status-1"]'); // Status 1 = current } // Create new version if ($browser->element('[data-testid="create-new-version-button"]')) { $browser->click('[data-testid="create-new-version-button"]') ->waitFor('[data-testid="rich-text-editor"]', 10); $v2Content = '

SOP Version 2.0

Updated version with improvements.

'; $browser->script(" const editor = document.querySelector('[data-testid=\"rich-text-editor\"]'); if (editor && editor.contentWindow) { editor.contentWindow.document.body.innerHTML = '{$v2Content}'; } "); if ($browser->element('[data-testid="change-summary-input"]')) { $browser->type('[data-testid="change-summary-input"]', 'Added improvements to the process'); } $browser->click('[data-testid="save-draft-button"]') ->waitForText('Draft saved', 10); $this->takeDebugScreenshot($browser, 'content-versioning-complete'); // Verify both versions exist $browser->assertSee('Version 1.0') ->assertSee('Version 2.0') ->assertSee('Current') ->assertSee('Draft'); } }); } /** * Test content permissions */ public function test_content_access_permissions(): void { $this->browse(function (Browser $browser) { // Create content as admin $this->loginAsAdmin($browser); $coreData = $this->setupCoreProcess($browser); // Create SOP content $browser->clickLink('SOP') ->waitFor('[data-tab="sop"]', 5) ->click('[data-testid="create-sop-button"]') ->waitFor('[data-testid="rich-text-editor"]', 10); $browser->script(" const editor = document.querySelector('[data-testid=\"rich-text-editor\"]'); if (editor && editor.contentWindow) { editor.contentWindow.document.body.innerHTML = '

Admin Created SOP

This content was created by an admin.

'; } "); $browser->click('[data-testid="save-draft-button"]') ->waitForText('Draft saved', 10); if ($browser->element('[data-testid="set-as-current-button"]')) { $browser->click('[data-testid="set-as-current-button"]') ->waitForText('Version set as current', 10); } // Logout and login as regular user $browser->logout(); $this->loginAsUser($browser); // Navigate to the same core $browser->visit($coreData['coreUrl']) ->waitFor('body', 10) ->clickLink('SOP') ->waitFor('[data-tab="sop"]', 5); $this->takeDebugScreenshot($browser, 'user-sop-view'); // User should see content but not create/edit buttons $browser->assertSee('Admin Created SOP') ->assertMissing('[data-testid="create-sop-button"]') ->assertMissing('[data-testid="create-new-version-button"]') ->assertMissing('[data-testid="set-as-current-button"]'); }); } }

'; $browser->script(" const editor = document.querySelector('[data-testid=\"rich-text-editor\"]'); if (editor && editor.contentWindow) { editor.contentWindow.document.body.innerHTML = `{$sopContent}`; } "); // Save as draft $browser->click('[data-testid="save-draft-button"]') ->waitForText('Draft saved', 10); $this->takeDebugScreenshot($browser, 'sop-content-saved'); // Verify content is displayed $browser->assertSee('Standard Operating Procedure') ->assertSee('Purpose') ->assertSee('Procedure') ->assertSee('Responsibilities'); }); } /** * Test activity category blueprint content creation */ public function test_activity_category_blueprint_content(): void { $this->browse(function (Browser $browser) { $this->loginAsAdmin($browser); // Navigate to category blueprint using the seeded category $categoryId = 1; // First seeded category $browser->visit("/content/blueprint/category/{$categoryId}") ->waitFor('body', 10); $this->takeDebugScreenshot($browser, 'category-blueprint-page'); // Create blueprint content if button exists if ($browser->element('[data-testid="create-blueprint-button"]')) { $browser->click('[data-testid="create-blueprint-button"]') ->waitFor('[data-testid="rich-text-editor"]', 10); $blueprintContent = '

Category Blueprint

Overview

This blueprint provides guidance for all activities in this category.

Best Practices

  • Follow standard naming conventions
  • Document all decisions
  • Review quarterly
'; $browser->script(" const editor = document.querySelector('[data-testid=\"rich-text-editor\"]'); if (editor && editor.contentWindow) { editor.contentWindow.document.body.innerHTML = `{$blueprintContent}`; } "); // Add change summary if field exists if ($browser->element('[data-testid="change-summary-input"]')) { $browser->type('[data-testid="change-summary-input"]', 'Initial category blueprint'); } $browser->click('[data-testid="save-draft-button"]') ->waitForText('Draft saved', 10); $this->takeDebugScreenshot($browser, 'category-blueprint-saved'); // Verify content $browser->assertSee('Category Blueprint') ->assertSee('Overview') ->assertSee('Best Practices'); } }); } /** * Test content versioning workflow */ public function test_content_versioning(): void { $this->browse(function (Browser $browser) { // Login and create a core $this->loginAsAdmin($browser); $coreData = $this->setupCoreProcess($browser); // Create initial SOP version $browser->clickLink('SOP') ->waitFor('[data-tab="sop"]', 5) ->click('[data-testid="create-sop-button"]') ->waitFor('[data-testid="rich-text-editor"]', 10); $v1Content = '

SOP Version 1.0

Initial version of the SOP.

'; $browser->script(" const editor = document.querySelector('[data-testid=\"rich-text-editor\"]'); if (editor && editor.contentWindow) { editor.contentWindow.document.body.innerHTML = '{$v1Content}'; } "); $browser->click('[data-testid="save-draft-button"]') ->waitForText('Draft saved', 10); // Set as current version if ($browser->element('[data-testid="set-as-current-button"]')) { $browser->click('[data-testid="set-as-current-button"]') ->waitForText('Version set as current', 10); // Verify status changed $browser->assertSee('Current') ->assertPresent('[data-testid="version-status-1"]'); // Status 1 = current } // Create new version if ($browser->element('[data-testid="create-new-version-button"]')) { $browser->click('[data-testid="create-new-version-button"]') ->waitFor('[data-testid="rich-text-editor"]', 10); $v2Content = '

SOP Version 2.0

Updated version with improvements.

'; $browser->script(" const editor = document.querySelector('[data-testid=\"rich-text-editor\"]'); if (editor && editor.contentWindow) { editor.contentWindow.document.body.innerHTML = '{$v2Content}'; } "); if ($browser->element('[data-testid="change-summary-input"]')) { $browser->type('[data-testid="change-summary-input"]', 'Added improvements to the process'); } $browser->click('[data-testid="save-draft-button"]') ->waitForText('Draft saved', 10); $this->takeDebugScreenshot($browser, 'content-versioning-complete'); // Verify both versions exist $browser->assertSee('Version 1.0') ->assertSee('Version 2.0') ->assertSee('Current') ->assertSee('Draft'); } }); } /** * Test content permissions */ public function test_content_access_permissions(): void { $this->browse(function (Browser $browser) { // Create content as admin $this->loginAsAdmin($browser); $coreData = $this->setupCoreProcess($browser); // Create SOP content $browser->clickLink('SOP') ->waitFor('[data-tab="sop"]', 5) ->click('[data-testid="create-sop-button"]') ->waitFor('[data-testid="rich-text-editor"]', 10); $browser->script(" const editor = document.querySelector('[data-testid=\"rich-text-editor\"]'); if (editor && editor.contentWindow) { editor.contentWindow.document.body.innerHTML = '

Admin Created SOP

This content was created by an admin.

'; } "); $browser->click('[data-testid="save-draft-button"]') ->waitForText('Draft saved', 10); if ($browser->element('[data-testid="set-as-current-button"]')) { $browser->click('[data-testid="set-as-current-button"]') ->waitForText('Version set as current', 10); } // Logout and login as regular user $browser->logout(); $this->loginAsUser($browser); // Navigate to the same core $browser->visit($coreData['coreUrl']) ->waitFor('body', 10) ->clickLink('SOP') ->waitFor('[data-tab="sop"]', 5); $this->takeDebugScreenshot($browser, 'user-sop-view'); // User should see content but not create/edit buttons $browser->assertSee('Admin Created SOP') ->assertMissing('[data-testid="create-sop-button"]') ->assertMissing('[data-testid="create-new-version-button"]') ->assertMissing('[data-testid="set-as-current-button"]'); }); } }

# E2E Test Suite Analysis and Execution Plan

## Overview
The E2E test suite covers the complete business process management workflow following the 4-level hierarchy:
1. **Process List** (/business-processes) - Seeded cards like "Environmental Scanning"
2. **Master Process** - The cards we click on
3. **Core Process** (/business-processes/{process}/cores/{core}) - With 4 tabs (SOP, RACI, Visual, Swimlane)
4. **Activity Blueprints** - Content for specific activities

## Foundation Requirement
All tests require a Core Process to work with. The `setupCoreProcess()` method in `BusinessProcessTestCase` handles this by:
1. Navigating to a seeded process (e.g., Environmental Scanning)
2. Creating a new core with unique name
3. Returning core details for the test to use

## Test Execution Order and Goals

### 1. **00_FoundationSetupTest.php** (3 test methods)
**Goal**: Verify the basic workflow that all other tests depend on
**Key Test Steps**:
- Test complete flow: Login → Dashboard → Business Processes → Process Card → Create Core → Core View
- Verify all 4 tabs are present and accessible
- Test the setupCoreProcess helper method
- Test core creation permissions for different roles

### 2. **ContentManagementTest.php** (4 test methods)
**Goal**: Test content creation and management at different hierarchy levels
**Key Test Steps**:
- Test SOP content creation at Core level
- Test Blueprint content at Activity Category level
- Test content versioning (Draft → Current → Archive)
- Test role-based access permissions for content

toolUseResult.originalFile:
# E2E Test Suite Analysis and Execution Plan

## Overview
The E2E test suite contains 8 comprehensive test files that run in **alphabetical order** by default and cover the complete business process management workflow.

## Test Execution Order and Goals

### 1. **ActivityBlueprintTest.php** (6 test methods)
**Goal**: Test category blueprint creation, versioning, and management workflows
**Key Test Steps**:
- Create comprehensive category blueprints with KPIs, resources, quality gates
- Test blueprint versioning (v1.0 → v2.0) with change summaries
- Test collaboration features (comments, reviews, approvals)
- Test template functionality for consistent formatting
- Test role-based access (User read-only vs Admin/Super Admin full access)
- Test integration with activity-specific blueprints

### 2. **AssessmentIntegrationTest.php** (9 test methods)
**Goal**: Test integration between assessment system and business process framework
**Key Test Steps**:
- Test navigation between assessments ↔ business processes
- Test assessment results linking to process recommendations
- Test business process context in assessment forms
- Test dashboard integration showing both systems
- Test user progress tracking across both systems
- Test data sharing (industry, business size filtering)
- Test role-based access integration
- Test notification integration
- Test mobile responsiveness for integrated features

### 3. **AuthorizationWorkflowTest.php** (12 test methods)
**Goal**: Test comprehensive role-based access control across all features
**Key Test Steps**:
- Test User role: Read-only access, no admin controls
- Test Admin role: Full management capabilities for processes/content
- Test Super Admin role: Complete system access including user management
- Test core process access permissions by role
- Test SOP/RACI content creation permissions
- Test blueprint management permissions
- Test version control permissions (who can set current/archive)
- Test assessment management permissions
- Test content deletion/modification permissions
- Test system settings access
- Test cross-system permission consistency
- Test permission inheritance and escalation

### 4. **BasicSetupTest.php** (5 test methods)
**Goal**: Test fundamental system setup and navigation flows
**Key Test Steps**:
- Test basic login and dashboard navigation
- Test core process navigation (4-tab interface)
- Test category blueprint navigation
- Test role-based access basics
- Test database and seeding verification

### 5. **BusinessProcessWorkflowTest.php** (8 test methods)  
**Goal**: Test complete end-to-end business process creation workflows
**Key Test Steps**:
- Test complete process creation: Category → Process → Core → Tabs
- Test SOP content creation with rich text editor
- Test RACI matrix creation and activity management
- Test Visual Diagram creation and editing
- Test Swimlane diagram functionality
- Test workflow transitions between tabs
- Test process publishing and approval workflows
- Test process archival and lifecycle management

### 6. **ContentLoadingTest.php** (1 test method)
**Goal**: Test React application loading and core UI elements
**Key Test Steps**:
- Test React app initialization and component loading
- Test navigation element presence (#app, nav, main)
- Test responsive design elements
- Test page load performance and debugging

### 7. **ContentVersioningTest.php** (6 test methods)
**Goal**: Test advanced version control for SOP and Blueprint content
**Key Test Steps**:
- Test SOP versioning workflow (Draft → Current → Archive)
- Test Blueprint versioning with change summaries
- Test version comparison and rollback functionality
- Test version status management (0=draft, 1=current, 2=future)
- Test concurrent version editing and conflict resolution
- Test version metadata tracking and audit trails

### 8. **CoreProcessManagementTest.php** (8 test methods)
**Goal**: Test 4-tab interface management and tab-specific functionality
**Key Test Steps**:
- Test SOP tab: Rich text content creation and editing
- Test RACI tab: Activity management and responsibility matrix
- Test Visual tab: Mermaid diagram creation and editing
- Test Swimlane tab: Cross-functional process flows
- Test tab switching and data persistence
- Test tab-specific permissions and access controls
- Test content synchronization across tabs
- Test tab workflow validation and requirements

### 9. **DebugNavigationTest.php** (1 test method)
**Goal**: Test core navigation flow with URL logging for debugging
**Key Test Steps**:
- Test Login → Dashboard → Business Processes navigation
- Log URLs at each step for debugging
- Verify React component loading at each stage

### 10. **HTMLImportWorkflowTest.php** (7 test methods)
**Goal**: Test HTML import functionality for RACI matrix population
**Key Test Steps**:
- Test successful HTML import from `/Users/tmeister/Desktop/raci-last-version.html`
- Test malformed HTML handling and error messages
- Test large HTML file import performance
- Test HTML parsing and activity/role extraction
- Test import preview and confirmation workflow
- Test import permissions (Admin only)
- Test import data validation and cleanup

### 11. **RACIMatrixTest.php** (8 test methods)
**Goal**: Test drag-and-drop RACI matrix functionality and responsibility management
**Key Test Steps**:
- Test drag-and-drop activity reordering with position updates
- Test responsibility assignment (R, A, C, I) for each role
- Test activity creation, editing, and deletion
- Test role management and assignment
- Test RACI validation rules and business logic
- Test bulk operations and import integration
- Test RACI export functionality
- Test real-time collaboration on RACI matrices

## Execution Commands

**Run individual test file**:
```bash
DUSK_HEADLESS_DISABLED=true script -q /dev/null php artisan dusk tests/Browser/[TestFileName].php
```

**Run specific test method**:
```bash
DUSK_HEADLESS_DISABLED=true script -q /dev/null php artisan dusk --filter="test_method_name"
```

**Run full suite**:
```bash
DUSK_HEADLESS_DISABLED=true script -q /dev/null php artisan dusk
```

## Test Database
- Uses isolated database: `business_process_e2e_tests`
- Configuration in `.env.dusk.local`
- Does not affect main application database

## Screenshots
- All tests include comprehensive screenshots in `tests/Browser/screenshots/`
- Debugging output shows navigation flow and element detection
- Visual verification of React component loading and business workflows

toolUseResult.originalFile:
# E2E Test Suite Analysis and Execution Plan

## Overview
The E2E test suite covers the complete business process management workflow following the 4-level hierarchy:
1. **Process List** (/business-processes) - Seeded cards like "Environmental Scanning"
2. **Master Process** - The cards we click on
3. **Core Process** (/business-processes/{process}/cores/{core}) - With 4 tabs (SOP, RACI, Visual, Swimlane)
4. **Activity Blueprints** - Content for specific activities

## Foundation Requirement
All tests require a Core Process to work with. The `setupCoreProcess()` method in `BusinessProcessTestCase` handles this by:
1. Navigating to a seeded process (e.g., Environmental Scanning)
2. Creating a new core with unique name
3. Returning core details for the test to use

## Test Execution Order and Goals

### 1. **00_FoundationSetupTest.php** (3 test methods)
**Goal**: Verify the basic workflow that all other tests depend on
**Key Test Steps**:
- Test complete flow: Login → Dashboard → Business Processes → Process Card → Create Core → Core View
- Verify all 4 tabs are present and accessible
- Test the setupCoreProcess helper method
- Test core creation permissions for different roles

### 2. **ContentManagementTest.php** (4 test methods)
**Goal**: Test content creation and management at different hierarchy levels
**Key Test Steps**:
- Test SOP content creation at Core level
- Test Blueprint content at Activity Category level
- Test content versioning (Draft → Current → Archive)
- Test role-based access permissions for content

### 3. **AssessmentIntegrationTest.php** (9 test methods)
**Goal**: Test integration between assessment system and business process framework
**Key Test Steps**:
- Test navigation between assessments ↔ business processes
- Test assessment results linking to process recommendations
- Test business process context in assessment forms
- Test dashboard integration showing both systems
- Test user progress tracking across both systems
- Test data sharing (industry, business size filtering)
- Test role-based access integration
- Test notification integration
- Test mobile responsiveness for integrated features

### 3. **AuthorizationWorkflowTest.php** (12 test methods)
**Goal**: Test comprehensive role-based access control across all features
**Key Test Steps**:
- Test User role: Read-only access, no admin controls
- Test Admin role: Full management capabilities for processes/content
- Test Super Admin role: Complete system access including user management
- Test core process access permissions by role
- Test SOP/RACI content creation permissions
- Test blueprint management permissions
- Test version control permissions (who can set current/archive)
- Test assessment management permissions
- Test content deletion/modification permissions
- Test system settings access
- Test cross-system permission consistency
- Test permission inheritance and escalation

### 4. **BasicSetupTest.php** (5 test methods)
**Goal**: Test fundamental system setup and navigation flows
**Key Test Steps**:
- Test basic login and dashboard navigation
- Test core process navigation (4-tab interface)
- Test category blueprint navigation
- Test role-based access basics
- Test database and seeding verification

### 5. **BusinessProcessWorkflowTest.php** (8 test methods)  
**Goal**: Test complete end-to-end business process creation workflows
**Key Test Steps**:
- Test complete process creation: Category → Process → Core → Tabs
- Test SOP content creation with rich text editor
- Test RACI matrix creation and activity management
- Test Visual Diagram creation and editing
- Test Swimlane diagram functionality
- Test workflow transitions between tabs
- Test process publishing and approval workflows
- Test process archival and lifecycle management

### 6. **ContentLoadingTest.php** (1 test method)
**Goal**: Test React application loading and core UI elements
**Key Test Steps**:
- Test React app initialization and component loading
- Test navigation element presence (#app, nav, main)
- Test responsive design elements
- Test page load performance and debugging

### 7. **ContentVersioningTest.php** (6 test methods)
**Goal**: Test advanced version control for SOP and Blueprint content
**Key Test Steps**:
- Test SOP versioning workflow (Draft → Current → Archive)
- Test Blueprint versioning with change summaries
- Test version comparison and rollback functionality
- Test version status management (0=draft, 1=current, 2=future)
- Test concurrent version editing and conflict resolution
- Test version metadata tracking and audit trails

### 8. **CoreProcessManagementTest.php** (8 test methods)
**Goal**: Test 4-tab interface management and tab-specific functionality
**Key Test Steps**:
- Test SOP tab: Rich text content creation and editing
- Test RACI tab: Activity management and responsibility matrix
- Test Visual tab: Mermaid diagram creation and editing
- Test Swimlane tab: Cross-functional process flows
- Test tab switching and data persistence
- Test tab-specific permissions and access controls
- Test content synchronization across tabs
- Test tab workflow validation and requirements

### 9. **DebugNavigationTest.php** (1 test method)
**Goal**: Test core navigation flow with URL logging for debugging
**Key Test Steps**:
- Test Login → Dashboard → Business Processes navigation
- Log URLs at each step for debugging
- Verify React component loading at each stage

### 10. **HTMLImportWorkflowTest.php** (7 test methods)
**Goal**: Test HTML import functionality for RACI matrix population
**Key Test Steps**:
- Test successful HTML import from `/Users/tmeister/Desktop/raci-last-version.html`
- Test malformed HTML handling and error messages
- Test large HTML file import performance
- Test HTML parsing and activity/role extraction
- Test import preview and confirmation workflow
- Test import permissions (Admin only)
- Test import data validation and cleanup

### 11. **RACIMatrixTest.php** (8 test methods)
**Goal**: Test drag-and-drop RACI matrix functionality and responsibility management
**Key Test Steps**:
- Test drag-and-drop activity reordering with position updates
- Test responsibility assignment (R, A, C, I) for each role
- Test activity creation, editing, and deletion
- Test role management and assignment
- Test RACI validation rules and business logic
- Test bulk operations and import integration
- Test RACI export functionality
- Test real-time collaboration on RACI matrices

## Execution Commands

**Run individual test file**:
```bash
DUSK_HEADLESS_DISABLED=true script -q /dev/null php artisan dusk tests/Browser/[TestFileName].php
```

**Run specific test method**:
```bash
DUSK_HEADLESS_DISABLED=true script -q /dev/null php artisan dusk --filter="test_method_name"
```

**Run full suite**:
```bash
DUSK_HEADLESS_DISABLED=true script -q /dev/null php artisan dusk
```

## Test Database
- Uses isolated database: `business_process_e2e_tests`
- Configuration in `.env.dusk.local`
- Does not affect main application database

## Screenshots
- All tests include comprehensive screenshots in `tests/Browser/screenshots/`
- Debugging output shows navigation flow and element detection
- Visual verification of React component loading and business workflows

content.text:
Perfect! I've completed all the tasks. Here's a summary of what was done:

## Summary of Changes

### 1. **Enhanced BusinessProcessTestCase.php**
- Added `setupCoreProcess()` method that handles the complete workflow:
  - Navigates to business processes
  - Clicks on a seeded process card
  - Creates a new core with unique name (using timestamp)
  - Returns core details for tests to use

### 2. **Created 00_FoundationSetupTest.php**
- Tests the basic workflow that all other tests depend on
- Verifies Login → Dashboard → Business Processes → Process Card → Create Core → Core View
- Tests role-based permissions for core creation
- Tests the setupCoreProcess helper method

### 3. **Created ContentManagementTest.php**
- Replaced the incorrectly named ActivityBlueprintTest
- Tests actual content types that exist:
  - Core → SOP
  - Activity Category → Blueprint
  - Content versioning
  - Role-based permissions

### 4. **Updated E2E Test Plan**
- Reflects correct 4-level hierarchy
- Documents foundation requirement (all tests need a core)
- Removed non-existent features (PDF export, search, filtering)
- Updated test numbering and descriptions

## Key Understanding
The correct hierarchy is:
1. **Process List** - Shows seeded cards like "Environmental Scanning"
2. **Master Process** - The cards we click on
3. **Core Process** - Where we work (with 4 tabs: SOP, RACI, Visual, Swimlane)
4. **Activity Blueprints** - Content for specific activities

Now you can run the foundation test to see the basic workflow in action:
```bash
DUSK_HEADLESS_DISABLED=true script -q /dev/null php artisan dusk tests/Browser/00_FoundationSetupTest.php
```
